title: Sed: Reformat Text Data
description: You have a file 'user_profiles.txt' in the 'data' directory where each line contains user data in the format: 'UserID: [ID], Name: [Full Name], Email: [EmailAddress]'. Transform each line into '[Full Name] ([ID]) - [EmailAddress]'.

setup_files.content:
UserID: 001, Name: Alice Wonderland, Email: alice@example.com
UserID: 002, Name: Bob The Builder, Email: bob@example.org
UserID: 003, Name: Charles Xavier, Email: charles@school.edu

evaluation.expected_stdout:
Alice Wonderland (001) - alice@example.com
Bob The Builder (002) - bob@example.org
Charles Xavier (003) - charles@school.edu

hints: You will need to use `sed` with a substitution command `s/.../.../`.
Enable extended regular expressions with `-E` (or `-r` on some systems) for easier group capturing.
Capture the ID, Full Name, and Email using parentheses `(...)` in your regex.
Refer to the captured groups in the replacement string using `\1`, `\2`, `\3`, etc.
Remember to match the literal text like 'UserID: ', ', Name: ', and ', Email: '. The `[^,]+` pattern can be useful for matching text up to the next comma.
